intro: Senecio tucumanensis, commonly known as the Tucumán groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Senecio tucumanensis is often found in rocky soils and is sometimes used in local horticulture for its ornamental value.
